definition[0]: one of the pair of signs ( ) put around words to show extra information
example[0]: Last year’s sales figures are given in brackets.
definition[1]: a piece of metal, wood, or plastic, often in the shape of the letter L, fixed to a wall to support something such as a shelf
definition[2]: to consider two or more people or things as being similar or the same
example[1]: Women and minors were bracketed together for the legislation.
example[2]: Arizona has been bracketed with Iowa in the tournament.
definition[3]: to put brackets around a written word, piece of information etc
definition[4]: a particular range that an amount or number, such as someone’s income or age, falls into
definition[5]: one of the ranges of amounts that people’s income is divided into for the purpose of deciding how much tax they should pay
example[6]: a rate of 35% in the top bracket (=for people with the highest incomes)
